info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 2:42PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Rain and snow to affect Marias Pass tonight... A fast moving weather system will move through all of Glacier County tonight. Rain showers will develop this evening along the divide, gradually changing to snow after Midnight. New snow accumulations tonight and into Thursday morning will generally be less than an inch over the plains of Glacier County, along with areas along Highway 2 over Marias Pass, and 1 to 3 inches in Glacier Park. Visibility could be reduced to less than a half mile at times in areas of heavier snowfall. Those traveling on Highway 2 over Marias Pass tonight and into Thursday morning should be alert for quickly changing road conditions and some slippery areas where the snow accumulates.
